benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Add custom fields to bundle

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple success scenarios with required and optional headers; HTTP 201 with JSON array returned; response objects match request (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC13, TC17, TC19).
Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON, empty body, invalid schema/missing fields, unsupported fields, duplicate field names, empty array handled with HTTP 400 (TC08, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC18).
Validation: Path parameter UUID format (TC05), non-existent bundle 404 (TC06), required header enforcement (TC07), extra query params tolerated without breaking behavior (TC13).
Large Payloads: Handling and performance thresholds for large arrays of CustomField (TC17).
Server Error Handling: Service unavailability and dependency failures yield 503; client timeout behavior considered (TC15, TC16, TC20).
Security: Negative tests for SQL injection and XSS ensure input is rejected or sanitized and no sensitive info is leaked (TC23, TC24).
Concurrency/Performance: Concurrent POSTs maintain consistency and acceptable response times (TC22).
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No scenario re-sends the same POST (e.g., retry after timeout) to verify idempotency or how duplicates are handled.
Server Error Handling (500): No simulation of internal errors such as database failure returning HTTP 500 with a standard error body.

Content negotiation and headers: No tests for missing/incorrect Content-Type (expect 415) or unacceptable Accept (406), and no assertions that the response has Content-Type application/json as specified by Produces.
Mixed-validity array semantics: No case where one CustomField in the array is invalid among valid ones to verify atomicity (all-or-nothing) and clear error reporting.
Schema boundary validation: No tests for field length limits, allowed characters, null/blank values, or value size constraints defined by the CustomField schema.
Uniqueness against existing data: No test for conflicts when a new field name already exists on the bundle (e.g., expect 400/409).
Persistence verification: No follow-up read to confirm created custom fields are actually stored for the bundle.
Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios exercising 429 responses or Retry-After behavior under high request rates (if applicable).
Response headers on success/errors: No checks for standard headers (e.g., Content-Type on all responses; Location if applicable for 201).
recommendations: Add idempotency/duplicate submission tests: resend the same request (with or without an idempotency key if supported) to confirm behavior (dedupe vs duplicate creation) and documented outcome.
Add a simulated internal failure test to validate HTTP 500 handling and consistent error schema (e.g., DB outage).
Add content negotiation tests: wrong/missing Content-Type -> 415; unacceptable Accept -> 406; assert Content-Type application/json on success and error responses.
Add a mixed-validity array scenario to verify atomicity: ensure the entire request fails with clear error details if any item is invalid.
Expand schema boundary tests: max/min lengths, allowed characters, null/blank values, and oversized values for CustomField fields.
Test uniqueness/conflict with existing bundle custom fields (duplicate name across requests) and verify expected error (400/409) and message.
Verify persistence by performing a follow-up GET of bundle custom fields and asserting the newly created entries are present.
If rate limiting applies, add scenarios to trigger 429 and validate Retry-After headers; combine with concurrent requests.
Assert response headers on success (Content-Type, and Location if provided) and on errors (Content-Type and standard error structure).
